Key Match Events: Australia beat Afghanistan by 4 runs at Adelaide Oval
Rashid Khan played an unbeaten knock of 48 off 23 balls
Glenn Maxwell played a knock of 54 as he guided Australia to 168/8 in 20 overs
Marcus Stoinis removed by Rashid Khan
Cameron Green, David Warner, and Steve Smith lost their wickets inside the powerplay
Fazalhaq Farooqi chipped in with two wickets
Rashid Khan and Mujeeb Ur Rahman contributed with one wicket each
Ibrahim Zadran and Gulbadin Naib put on a 59-run partnership
Glenn Maxwell's direct hit caused the dismissal of Gulbadin Naib
Rashid Khan scored 48 in just 23 balls
Post-Match Reflections: Matthew Wade, the skipper of Australia, said it was nerve-wracking and had seen Rashid Khan win such games 3-4 times in the Indian T20 league
Matthew Wade mentioned that the tournament hasn't gone their way and they were slow to get off the blocks
Matthew Wade informed that they are hopeful for the return of Aaron Finch and Tim David in the next game if they progress further
Mohammad Nabi, the captain of Afghanistan, said it was a good game and they started off well
Mohammad Nabi credited Naveen-ul-Haq for bowling well and restricting the Australians to a chaseable total
Mohammad Nabi mentioned that they threw their wickets away quickly in the middle order and came under pressure
Glenn Maxwell, the Player of the Match, said that Afghanistan played really well and struck the ball cleanly
Glenn Maxwell mentioned that Afghanistan put them under pressure in the Powerplay and gave them a scare toward the end
Glenn Maxwell shared that it skidded on during the second innings and the wicket was slow during the day
Glenn Maxwell credited Afghanistan for the way they bowled in the last four overs
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand became the first team to qualify for the semi-finals
Australia needs Sri Lanka to beat England to progress to the semi-finals
